text:
From redhat 9 to localhost or from HPUX11.11 to redhat 9 it works.
From redhat 9 to HPUX11.11 or from HPUX11.11 to HPUX11.11 it doesn't. It comes 
back with this:

Buildfile: build.xml
ftp:
      [ftp] listing files
      [ftp] 0 files listed
BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 3 seconds

In the logs below I would expect to see a LIST command but I don't.

Here are the logs from the HPUX11.11 box.
Jun  3 14:52:55 denmark ftpd[1870]: USER ftreado
Jun  3 14:52:55 denmark ftpd[1870]: PASS password
Jun  3 14:52:55 denmark ftpd[1870]:  PAM_TEXT_INFO: Last   successful login 
for ftreado: Thu Jun  3 14:41:41 CST6CDT 2004 on tty .
Jun  3 14:52:55 denmark ftpd[1870]:  PAM_TEXT_INFO: Last unsuccessful login 
for ftreado: Tue Feb 24 13:18:10 CST6CDT 2004 on tty .
Jun  3 14:52:55 denmark ftpd[1870]: FTP LOGIN FROM 10.11.12.84 [10.11.12.84], 
ftreado
Jun  3 14:52:55 denmark ftpd[1870]: TYPE Image
Jun  3 14:52:55 denmark ftpd[1870]: CWD /home/marimba
Jun  3 14:52:56 denmark ftpd[1870]: PWD
Jun  3 14:52:56 denmark ftpd[1870]: CWD /home/marimba
Jun  3 14:52:56 denmark ftpd[1870]: PWD
Jun  3 14:52:56 denmark ftpd[1870]: CWD /home/marimba
Jun  3 14:52:56 denmark ftpd[1870]: SYST
Jun  3 14:52:56 denmark ftpd[1870]: PORT
Jun  3 14:52:56 denmark ftpd[1870]: CDUP
Jun  3 14:52:56 denmark ftpd[1870]: CWD /home/marimba
Jun  3 14:52:56 denmark ftpd[1870]: QUIT
Jun  3 14:52:56 denmark ftpd[1870]: FTP session closed

Here is my build.xml file
<project name="TestFtp" default="ftp" basedir=".">
    <target name="ftp">
        <ftp server="denmark.hrblock.net"
             remotedir="/home/marimba"
             listing="mylisting"
             userid="ID REMOVED"
             password="PWREMOVED"
             action="list"
             verbose="yes"
         >
            <fileset>
                <include name="**"/>
            </fileset>
         </ftp>
    </target>
</project>
creator: ken@sundive.net

text:
Can you try to install commons-net-1.2.2 and let us know if it fixes your problem.
I think it should.
creator: antoine@apache.org
bodewig@apache.org
text: assuming it will be fixed with a more recent version of commons-net
